scanner

Class CardScanner

  • java.lang.Object
    • scanner.CardScanner

  • public class CardScanner
extends java.lang.Object
    The CardScanner class represents the card scanner device. In actual use, the CardScanner will receive the barcode as the input. However, to simplify, we consider the input as a sequence of 8 uppercase letters. Here are example of how CardScanner can be used to scan input barcode 

         import scanner.CardScanner;
     
     String pseudoBarCode = "ABCDEFGH";
     CardScanner cardScanner = CardScanner.getInstance();
     String cardId = cardScanner.process(pseudoBarCode);

      • process

        public java.lang.String process(java.lang.String pseudoBarCode)
                         throws customexception.InvalidIDException
        convert the barcode of the card to card code
        Parameters:
        pseudoBarCode - is a string of 8 uppercases letters representing the input card's barCode
        Returns:
        the card code (16 bits)
        Throws:
        customexception.InvalidIDException - throw when the pseudoBarCode is invalid
